title: Average hours spent watching TV weekly in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015
summary: The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes Share of respondents. In total the number of data points it has is 5.
Overall Share of respondents has increased over the Year.
Share of respondents is roughly constant from 11_to_20_hours to I_don't_watch_TV, and lastly slightly increasing from I_don't_watch_TV to More_than_20_hours.
The most drastic increase took place within the Year I_don't_watch_TV and More_than_20_hours.
The highest Share of respondents, of value 39.0 was reached at Year More_than_20_hours
The lowest Share of respondents, of value 2.0 was reported at Year I_don't_watch_TV

max_summary: This is a line chart with an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Share of respondents, containing a total of 5 data points.
Overall Share of respondents has increased over the Year.
Share of respondents is roughly constant from 11_to_20_hours to I_don't_watch_TV, and lastly slightly increasing from I_don't_watch_TV to More_than_20_hours.
The most drastic increase took place within the Year I_don't_watch_TV and More_than_20_hours.
The highest Share of respondents, of value 39.0 was reached at Year More_than_20_hours
The lowest Share of respondents, of value 2.0 was reported at Year I_don't_watch_TV

The line drastically remained stable by 3.4 times from Year 11_to_20_hours to 5_hours_or_less,remained stable by 2.0 times from Year 5_hours_or_less to 6_to_10_hours,remained stable by 9.0 times from Year 6_to_10_hours to I_don't_watch_TV, and lastly, increased by 19.5 times from Year I_don't_watch_TV to More_than_20_hours.
